text: AdviceI am   I have schizophrenia  I am not currently psychotic  I have insight  I know the voices are artifacts and misfiring neurotransmitters in my brain  I have had this diagnoses since I was   or   For over a decade I have been medicated and tried therapy  I have been hospitalized ten times or more  I know this illness will never go away  My maintenance phases get shorter  My last break was bad  My next break might see me on the street and I may never come back from it  The idea of fighting this for another   or   or   years or spending that amount of time drifting in and out of psychosis while on the street is frightening  I would tell someone on my care team but they would instantly pink slip me and I would spend   hours pretending to care about group therapy in a psychiatric ward and talk to a doctor for a total of five minutes before they released me  It is all about liability here  If anyone can give me an objective  logical reason why I should continue to exist I will not kill myself  Not  things can always improve  or  you need to adjust your meds  Something concrete  I have already tried so many permutations of medications and therapies that I have lost faith in those things  I am planning on killing myself within   or   hours using a method with a   lethality rate if I cannot find an anchor  Reddit is pathetically my last chance
summary: I have schizophrenia. I know the voices are artifacts and misfiring neurotransmitters in my brain. For over a decade I have been medicated and tried therapy. I've been hospitalized ten times or more. The next break might see me on the street. Reddit is my last chance.
cleaned: schizophrenia know voice artefact misfire neurotransmitter brain decade medicate try therapy hospitalize time break street geddit chance
